Dear Ms. Williams-Burton:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/24/2019. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
Three out of eight licensing records reviewed indicated that the licensing
recommendation to the department was made 5, 10, and 13 days before the
expiration of the license. One licensing record could not be determined as the dated
transaction record sent to the department was not uploaded into MiSACWIS.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(d) Notify all social service workers who have children placed
in the home that a special evaluation has been initiated.
One out of four special evaluations reviewed did not clearly identify that the social
service workers who have children placed in the home that a special evaluation has
been initiated. The section of the CWL-4005 Special Evaluation Report that prompts
for the worker’s and child’s first name along with the date notified was left blank. It is
noted in the section regarding foster parent notification that the licensing worker
“spoke with the foster care worker on 01/02/2019…” though does not name the
foster care worker, nor states whether that foster care worker is assigned to all three
foster children in the home.
4

R 400.12417 Foster parent information.
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement of a
child:
(a) Child's name.
(b) Child’s date of birth.
(c) Available known information about the child’s health.
(d) Any known history of abuse or neglect of the child.
(e) All known emotional and psychological factors relating to
the care of the child.
(f) All known behaviors of the child.
(g) Circumstances necessitating placement or replacement of
the child.
(h) Any other known information to enable the foster parent
to provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the
foster child and the foster family, including information
about siblings who do not reside in the foster home.
(i) Name of assigned social service worker.
(j) Authorization to provide routine and emergency medical
care.
One out of eight applicable foster care cases reviewed did not contain the agency’s
placement information form given to the foster parent at time of the change of
placement.

DHHS Policy Required Participation in Development - Foster Parent /
FOM 722-08C Caregiver and Birth Parent
Page 2
The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required and
indicates that the foster parent/caregiver acknowledges and
agrees to the activities required to meet the needs of the child in
their care.
Signatures must be documented within 30 days.
One out of eight foster care records reviewed did not contain the signature of the
foster parent on one treatment plan.
One out of eight applicable foster care records reviewed contained a birth parent
signature beyond 30 days from completion of the service plan.
REPEAT CITATION FROM 10/10/2018 INTERIM INSPECTION

Page 11-12
Siblings in foster care, who are not placed together, must have
at least one visit per calendar month that is in addition to

6

visits within two separate report periods.
DHHS Policy Medical Passports
FOM 801 Page
11-13
All medical information within the medical passport must be
current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child's
current and complete health information.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
• Legal parents, foster care provider, and all medical and mental
health professionals.
Seven out of eight foster care records reviewed were deficient with the requirements
of medical passports. Six case records did not contain verification of the passport
being given to the medical professional and one record was deficient one quarterly
passport.
One out of four independent living records reviewed was deficient four medical
passports.
REPEAT CITATION FROM 10/10/2018 INTERIM INSPECTION

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(f) Conclusions regarding licensing rules compliance or
noncompliance based on the findings of fact.
One special evaluation noted within the analysis section of the report that the foster
parent was found to be in non-compliance with based on the interviews and
investigation. It is recommended that the analysis section of the report clearly state
whether the foster parent is compliant or non-compliant with the stated rule and the
rationale as to why the worker came to that conclusion.
R400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(2) All of the following shall be in the case record before a youth
is placed in independent living:
(e) An evaluation of a youth's need for supervision and a plan
for providing the level of supervision determined necessary.
Agency initial intake states "Need for increased supervision". Is recommended that
the agency specifically state how much more increased supervision is necessary
beyond that of monthly.
DHHS IL+ Credentials-Staff Training and Qualifications-Weekly
Contract Oct 17: Documentation
2.8.a.12 page 10
The ILP Coach:
e) Must complete a weekly ILP log documenting actions and
tasks related to a specific goal or outcome along with hours
spent with each child.
8

Agency IL skill tracking forms in hard file though not uploaded in MiSACWIS. It is
recommended that all case related information be uploaded into MiSACWIS.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were two incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. The foster parents’ corrective action plans included additional training and
review of agency policies and procedures. The corrective action plans were
appropriate.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The corrective action plan was for the
agencies 10/10/2018 interim inspection report. It appropriately addressed the
following as no repeat citations are noted: Foster parent training, borrowed home
documentation, timely initiating of special evaluations, caseworker notification
following a special evaluation, annual physical examinations for foster care
independent living cases, late foster care and independent living service plans,
documentation of independent living eligibility, timely licensure of relatives, obtaining
birth parent signatures on service plans, completion of quarterly FTM’s, unannounced
visits to foster homes, birth parent quarterly home visits, timely supervisory approval
on USP’s, and quarterly completion of independent living assessments. Repeat
citations are as follows: Foster parent information being given to foster parents at or
prior to placement, timely approval of USP’s, medical passports, foster parent
signatures on service plans, and APPLA information being uploaded. It is noted that
the quantity of citations per each of these rules has notably decreased since the last
inspection.
The 07/17/2019 analyst report did not indicate any safety concerns as being noted.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
